text: CLOSE ON JESSE'S face, eyes closed, angelic, beautiful. Slowly, the CAMERA PULLS BACK and her twisted, bleeding b is revealed, tangled in a tattered dress. It appears a violent crime has just taken place. CLOSE ON a man's face. It is DEAN, handsome, slightly awkward. He stares at the scene, entranced by Jesse’s figure. He raises a still camera. Jesse’s image is reflected in miniature in the glass lens. He takes a photo, and the bl shutter closes and opens on Jesse’s body, the mechanical sound a startling contrast to the eerie quiet of the room The CAMERA PULLS BACK again, revealing that the crime sce is actually a fashion photo shoot. The clicks of Dean’s camera, uneven at first, grow rapid regular. A frenetic, percussive score. With every shot, a new image of Jesse appears on the nearby computer screen. As though waking from a dream, Jesse's eyes open...

She is seated in front of a mirror, staring at her reflec with wide eyes. Her face still appears bloody and battere from the shoot. She begins taking off the make-up. From across the room, RUBY, 27, simultaneously iron-wille and fragile, watches her every move. Jesse senses her gaz
Am I staring?
I don’t mind.
Sorry. Occupational hazard. Ruby waves a fist full of make-up brushes.
(a revelation) You did my make-up.
Yeah. Like an hour ago. You don’t remember?
Sorry -
What, did you have a stroke between then and now?
I thought you were in the next shoot. Ruby laughs. Jesse doesn’t understand the joke.
(touched) Oh, you’re serious.
Yeah.
Well, here, let me help you. Ruby rushes over and begins wiping away some bloody make- out of reach behind Jesse’s ear.
I’m Ruby, by the way.
I'm -
Jesse. You told me earlier. You’re a little bit deer-in-the- headlights.
I just moved here. Six weeks ago.
Please don’t be from New York. Last thing we need is another pretty bitch without a soul.
I'm from Ridgecrest.
Where’s that?
Near Death Valley.
Spooky. What’s in Death Valley?
Nothing worth sticking around for. Ruby smiles, a genuine understanding.
Your skin is perfect. Look at you. She leans in, examining Jesse in the mirror, their faces nearly touching.

I don’t think you’re even human. (whispering) If I killed you, would you die? Ruby playfully holds up her hands, covered in bloody make RUBY (CONT’D) I swear I didn’t do it! She begins cleaning her hands with a small cloth. RUBY (CONT’D) Shit, what time is it? I promised Dee and Dum over there a ride. Ruby nods toward two ULTRA-THIN MODELS leaning against ea other in the corner of the room. They are totally bored. looks like it takes every bit of effort to hold themselve upright. RUBY (CONT’D) You think they’ve ever had lunch? Probably don’t even know what it is. ‘Wanna go to lunch?’ Probably think it’s a day-spa. (to Jesse) Hey, you wanna come? We’re going to this club in West Hollywood. Please. You'll be saving me from a thirty minute ride with the world’s only living exoskeletons. One of the thin girls sighs deeply.
Do I get shotgun?
Deal. Ruby tosses the blood-covered cloth on the make-up table. She claps loudly, startling the thin girls to life.
Ashley! Mary-Kate! Andele! Party time! They stand and slink out of the room. Ruby rolls her eyes they leave. Jesse turns back to the mirror and runs a hand down the s of her face, touching her skin.

Jesse finishes changing. Several MODELS in various states of undress sit at a row tables as stylists scurry between them. At the corner mirror, one girl places a palm to her reflection, tears running silently down her face. Jesse notices her as she stands to go.
Jesse heads through the studio toward the exit, the set f her shoot disappearing farther and farther into the background.
She walks alone through the winding hallways of the build

We watch from above as she spirals down a long internal staircase. The sound of wind, gradually intensifying... EXT. RUBY’S CAR/HIGHWAY - DUSK 7 CLOSE ON the sleek hood of the car, slicing through the a It flies down the highway, weaving defiantly through traf  10 11 12 13 INT. RUBY’S CAR - DUSK 8 Ruby drives, the two thin models slumped in the backseat. Jesse stares out the passenger seat window, mesmerized by neon lights of Los Angeles. Ruby pays dangerously little attention to the road in an effort to sneak looks at Jesse. One of the thin models springs to life.
You missed your exit.
Oh, it speaks. The thin girl hisses at her.
Back in your cage. Ruby makes a risky maneuver on the highway and Jesse grip the car door, white-knuckled. RUBY (CONT’D) I won’t really kill you, I promise.

The car exits the highway and drives into West Hollywood. EXT. RUBY’S CAR - NIGHT 10 It pulls up to the curb and screeches to a sharp halt. INT. RUBY’S CAR - NIGHT 11 Jesse releases the car door, stretching her cramped hand.
All four girls exit the car. We watch them disappear down the street, headed to the club.

Jesse and Ruby stand inside the entrance. MUSIC BLASTS at a deafening level. The tremendous main r is completely congested with sweaty dancers. The walls, lined with floor-to-ceiling mirrors, reflect a galaxy of pretty, bouncing lights. Someone waves to Ruby across the room. She turns to Jesse and shouts over the music.
Be right back!
What?
Don’t go anywhere. Promise?

I can’t hear you. Ruby disappears into the crowd. Jesse walks around the perimeter of the room, watching th reflections of the club in the mirrored walls. She spots a pair of eyes watching her. They belong to JAC 37, leaning casually against a pillar in a shadowed corne the room. He is striking, fashionable, and holds himself with unintentional arrogance. When their eyes connect, it unclear how long he has been looking at her. SARAH, 24, plenty of eyeliner, flirts with him, but fails hold his attention. Jack makes his thumbs and forefingers into a square, hold them up, and squints. JACK'S POV: Jesse gazes back at him, captured within the frame. Sarah sees the gesture and looks across the room for the recipient. Jesse is identified. She whips around and crashes head-first into DEAN. He smi at her.
I was hoping you would be here. Jesse cannot hear him.
I'm looking for my friend.  14 He leans closer.

(louder) Ruby? Do you know Ruby? He nods in acknowledgment and gestures for Jesse to follo him. They start across the room, searching for Ruby. Dean glances over his shoulder and sees Jesse struggling make her way through the crowd. He reaches out. Their hands lock.

Dean and Jesse push through a back door into a small, dar alcove. The MUSIC, still pulsing, is muffled. They both exhale, relieved to be away from the crowd. A LONELY SMOKER dressed in black leans against the brick while two GAY MEN kiss hungrily across from her. The smok watches them, sucking her Marlboro, unmoved. Jesse and Dean smile at the scene, then look at each othe searching for something to say.
You hungry? She shakes her head. DEAN (CONT’D) Do you want a drink? I could get you a drink.
I’m okay. A silence.
You did great today. By the way. At the shoot.
Thanks. He looks down, hands in pockets, and shifts nervously. Je watches him carefully, amused.
Would you say... I really killed it? He looks up, surprised. She smiles, coy.
Bad?
Pretty bad.
I can do worse.
Okay.
Why did they build a gate around the cemetery?
I don’t know. Why?
Because people were dying to get in. Small laughs.
What do you do with a dead chemist?
What?
You Barium. More laughs. They move a little closer.
Okay, I’ve got one.
Is it bad?
Very.
How bad?
The worst. Get ready.
Okay.
You ready?
Ready.
You sure?
I’m sure.
What did one dead guy say to the other?
What? They are close enough to kiss. Dean looks down at her fac He is once again enraptured.
I - can’t remember the punch line. The moment is broken as the back door swings open and mus blasts into the alcove.
Jesse! Ruby heads toward them, clutching a bottle of champagne. is followed by GIGI, 21, very charming, very sexy. Ruby sizes them up, trying to decide what she interrupted
You know Dean.
Yeah, sure.
We were just looking for you.
Clearly.  10. Gigi giggles.
I should get back in there. Nice to see you, Ruby. And -
Gigi. Dean places a hand on the small of Jesse’s back and whisp in her ear.
Find me if you need a getaway. She nods.
Well, that was rude. Jesse smiles, unable to take her eyes off him as he walks back into the club. We move in on her face until...

The sound of a POP breaks Jesse’s trance. Bubbles spill d the side of a champagne bottle. Jesse blinks and looks around the room, as though only ju realizing she is there. She glances curiously at some graffiti on the wall which reads, ‘DO WHAT THOU WILT.’ Ruby drinks straight from the bottle, perched on the edge the sink, nearly slipping. Gigi checks her reflection in bathroom mirror, smoothing the skin around her nose.
Does my nose still look swollen?
No, but your ass does.
Very funny. Someone knocks on the bathroom door.
(shouts ) We're in here!
What happened to your nose?  11.
Why? Does it look bad?
Gigi’s going full Barbie.
What?
All plastic. Gigi slaps Ruby playfully on the backside and chases her around the room. Ruby hops on the toilet seat for safety.
Sanctuary!
You had surgery?
God, you say it like it’s a bad thing.
No, it’s just - have you done it a lot?
Not really. Ruby hiccups and holds up seven fingers behind Gigi’s bac
I go to this guy in Beverly Hills if you want his number.
(dreamy ) Oh, Andrew...
Doctor Andrew.
You love him.
Of course I do. Look at me. Gigi presents herself.  12. GIGI (CONT’D) He calls me the Bionic Woman.
Is that a compliment? Ruby snorts champagne. Someone knocks on the door again.
(shouts ) We're in here!
Where’s Sarah? I wanna dance.
Just go. She’1l be lurking around Jack for the rest of the night, poor thing.
Sarah's in love with Jack because they fucked once, like a thousand years ago -
Be nice.
But everyone knows he’s only interested in starving preteen babydolls -
Hey -
What?
Not in front of the kid. Gigi and Ruby turn to Jesse.

Oh, I’m not a virgin. A strange silence as the conversation comes to a halt. Gi and Ruby exchange a quick look. Ruby dangles the champagn bottle lifelessly between her knees. Another knock at the door breaks the tension. Gigi, annoy undoes the lock and Sarah bursts in, pushing Jesse behind door.  16 17 13.
Well, he’s stoned out of his mind and acting like an asshole, surprise-surprise. (to Ruby) Move. Sarah pushes Ruby off the toilet and sits to pee.
I'll probably still go home with him because I’m such a pushover. Ruby slams the bottle on the sink and storms out of the bathroom.
What? What did I say? Gigi presents Jesse.
Sarah, this is Jesse. Jesse offers a hand, but Sarah grabs the toilet paper instead.
I think we met.

Even LOUDER MUSIC. Sarah, Gigi, and Jesse dance in the middle of the crowd. Gigi bounces around like a ball on a string. She grabs Jesse’s hand and spins her. The world whips around in circles. As she spins, Jesse sees Ruby watching them across the da floor. With each turn, Ruby’s face becomes closer and clearer, her expression hard and fixed on Jesse. The sound of RUBBER AGAINST THE ROAD as... EXT. DEAN’S CAR/HIGHWAY - NIGHT 17 The wheels of the car spin down the highway.  18 19 20 21 22 14. INT. DEAN’S CAR - NIGHT 18 Jesse stares at her reflection in the window of the car. looks past herself and sees Dean’s reflection, driving steadily. She leans her head against the window next to his image. eyes begin to close. JESSE’S DREAM 19 A fuzzy, pink surface. An image out of focus. After a while, the image becomes clear, and we realize we are loo at skin. We see an arm. A pair of shoulder blades. A collarbone. An elbow. A mouth. Odd angles of seemingly dismembered portions of a WOMAN’S BEAUTIFUL BODY. INT. DEAN’S CAR/JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 20 CLOSE ON Dean’s face. The CAMERA PULLS BACK and we see th he is watching Jesse sleep in the passenger seat. After a few moments, her eyes open, and she looks around, disoriented.
Where are we? She glances out the window. The motel is run-down, depressing, cheap. She is a little embarrassed.
Oh. How long was I asleep?
Not long. She rubs her eyes and gathers her things.
Thanks for the ride.
Jesse climbs up the rusty outdoor stairs to her motel doo EXT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT -— CONTINUOUS 22 She pulls a set of keys from her bag and is about to open door when...  23 15.
Hey. She turns and leans on the balcony rail, looking down ove Dean.
What did one dead guy say to the other?
What?
Nothing. He’s dead. Dean smiles. Jesse smiles.
I want to see you again.
Okay.

Tomorrow. She nods. Dean points up, and she turns her head to the sky. The fu moon is perfectly luminous. She gazes at it in awe as Dea car springs to life and drives away. She turns to her motel room. One number hangs on the door the other has long gone missing. The color has chipped aw revealing multiple coats of hideous paint. The lock takes bit of effort with the key, but it finally clicks.

Jesse steps into the room, leaving the front door half op She flips the light switch a few times, but it doesn’t wo Aside from the ambient moonlight shining through the wind the room is dark and eerie. Jesse tries to see into the space. Her skin prickles as s senses that something or someone is in the room. She make out a shape in the dark which starts to approach her. She quickly steps out of the room, slamming the door shut.  24 25 16. EXT. MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT -— CONTINUOUS 24 Jesse stares at the door, unsure of her next move. The drapes inside the room move slightly, as if someone brush past them. She glances around her, but the parking lot is deserted. only sounds come from televisions in neighboring rooms an the muffled roar of the distant highway. She turns to the door again and takes a deep breath. She about to slip her key in the lock when a loud bang hits t door from the inside. She drops the keys and walks away.

A LITTLE BELL JINGLES as Jesse runs through the door and hurriedly approaches the Night Manager, HANK. He is a fak tanned, hair-straightened, middle-aged, failed actor. He obviously once very good looking, but now borders on the grotesque. Hank sits at the front desk, feet up, cutting his nails w a small switchblade.
Someone is in my room. Unimpressed, he does not look up from his work.
What do you mean someone is in your room?
I went to let myself in, and I heard someone. Hank takes her in.
Are you high? Jesse takes out her cell phone and starts to dial.
What are you doing?
I’m calling the police.
Whoa. Relax, okay?  He snaps the blade shut and whistles to the back room. MIKEY, a skinny, grungy biker kid appears.
Mikey?
Yeah?

This lady has an unwanted guest. 17. Mikey looks at both of them. He picks up a baseball bat. 26 EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - NIGHT 26 The threesome climb the stairs. Hank, following at the re looks at Jesse’s ass and grunts, impressed. She turns aro and he winks. 27
Jesse struggles to make her key work in the lock. Hank si impatiently.
Mikey, go get the spare. Uh -
Jesse.
(suggestively) Jesse and I will wait here. Mikey scrutinizes the door, makes a decision, and kicks i open.
28 Hank shines his flashlight in the room, which we now see been torn to pieces. Jesse’s clothes are scattered everywhere.
What the fuck? You’re going to have to pay for this.
I didn’t do it. It wasn’t me.  29 30 31 18.
Nice try, sweetheart. We don’t foot the bill for your pissed off boyfriends.

I’m telling you, it wasn’t me! Mikey, meanwhile, is investigating the room. He shines a flashlight across the back wall, revealing that the windo open. He moves the light down and stops on a crouched figure. I is a WILDCAT eating into the cheek of another dead animal the floor. The wildcat slowly glances up and stares into light for a moment before returning to his meal.
There’s your visitor.
The SOUND OF A DING. Stainless steel elevator doors close on Jesse’s reflectio She grazes her fingers across her cheek, thinking about t wildcat from the night before.
Jesse walks down a long, stark white hallway of doors.

She opens the door to a room crowded with plastic folding chairs. FIFTY MODELS, all variations of the same girl, si anxiously, quietly waiting. Every head snaps to Jesse as steps inside. She crosses to the CHECK-IN GIRL at a folding table in th corner. The Girl, twenty-something, smacks her gum hard a does not look up from the fashion magazine she is reading

Write down your name and your agency. Have a seat. They’ll call you in. Jesse scribbles her information on the clipboard. She pul a comp card from her bag. The Girl flips a page.  32 33 34 19. CHECK-IN GIRL (CONT’D) Just put it with the others. Jesse places her photo on top of a very tall pile. She turns around and sees every set of eyes still fixed o her. They follow her as she finds an empty folding chair the corner of the room and sits. The door swings open and every head looks to the NEW GIRL she walks in. Jesse slumps down in her seat. She pulls a pair of headphones from her bag and puts them on. MUSIC BLASTS as her thoughts leave the room...

A series of JUMP CUTS: Sun shining through the clouds. Ba feet run on hard concrete. A pair of skinny knees drop to the ground. A girl’s hands grip the edge of a swimming po We see YOUNG JESSE’s face reflected in the water. She loo at herself for a long time before reaching out a hand and skimming the surface, distorting her face.

Jesse peels the nail polish off her fingernails. Every model in the room rises at once. A female CASTING ASSISTANT stands by the door, ushering the girls into the studio. Jesse rips off her headphones, gathers her things and follows the line inside. She passes the Check-in Girl, still engrossed in her magazine, as she blows an enormous bubble which threatens pop.

The studio is very bright. Big windows line one side of t room and racks of clothing line the other. Jesse stands with the group of girls against a side wall. They are positioned shoulder-to-shoulder, almost militant awaiting instruction.  20. In the center of the room, the fashion designer, SUJI, an elegant Korean woman in her 40s, sits at a long table. Standing behind her right shoulder is the TRANSLATOR. The Casting Assistant slams the door hard. She places the stack of comp cards on the Designer’s table and crosses t the models.

You can undress. Like clockwork, the models strip off their jeans and t- shirts, dropping them in heaps on the ground. They stand tall in their underwear and heels. The Assistant hands each model a paper sheet with a numbe it. The FIRST MODEL is called forward. She holds up her numbe as the Assistant snaps a Polaroid. The Translator converses for an interminably long time in Korean, pointing to the model’s face and hips, clearly discussing the girl’s features. The model tries not to lo nervous. Suji remains silent, simply shakes her head.

Thank you. That will be all. The model rejoins the group as another is called forward. Jesse scans the faces behind her, wondering how long this will take. She spots an anxious SARAH in the back corner. Another model is dismissed, and Suji frowns, surveying th group. She locks eyes with Jesse. She points.
Come forward please. Jesse points to herself.
Can you come forward? Jesse walks to the center of the room. Suji speaks.
She wants to know, how old are you?
Nineteen.  35 21. The Translator repeats this in Korean. Suji puts on her glasses and examines Jesse suspiciously.
I just had my birthday. Jesse fidgets. The Assistant stands in front of her and takes a Polaroid The bright flash startles her.

Raise your arms. Jesse raises her arms above her head. We see that she is very thin, her ribs clearly defined under stretched skin. The Assistant pulls a measuring tape from around her neck begins to measure the various circumferences of her body, scribbling notes on a clipboard. She notices the models watching her every move. ASSISTANT (CONT’D) How much do you weigh?
(distracted) Sorry...?
Your weight.
One-oh-two. The Assistant scribbles.

Can you do the walk? Jesse walks from one side of the room to the other, her H TAPPING a confident rhythm on the hardwood floor. Sarah peers behind another girl to try and get a better look. When she finishes, Jesse stands in front of the table. A long, silent moment as Suji decides. She nods.
Very good.

An ELEVATOR DING.  36 37 22. Jesse’s smiling reflection is torn in two as the elevator doors part ways. She is about to step inside when she hea a LOUD CRASH. She turns toward the noise. The crash is followed by the SOUND OF A WOMAN CRYING. She walks slowly down the hall to investigate.
Jesse presses her ear to the bathroom door which bears th hot pink icon of a woman’s figure.
Hello?

Please go away. She pushes the door open. INT. WOMEN’S RESTROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS 37 Jesse steps inside and sees SARAH’s distorted reflection front of a shattered mirror. Shards cover the sink and floor. Sarah turns toward Jesse, mascara running down her face, red from crying.
I SAID GET THE FUCK OUT! Are you deaf?
Sarah?

Fuck, it’s you. Perfect. She slides down the bathroom wall and slumps on the groun The broken mirror crunches under her weight. Jesse notices a few cuts on Sarah’s arm which have alread begun to heal. Sarah covers them with her hand.
(defensive) I cut myself when the mirror broke. Someone tries to open the door from the outside. Jesse pushes it shut.
We're in here.  23. They try again, and Jesse bangs on the opposite side of t door.
I said we're in here! The woman gives up, mumbling some profanity. Jesse clicks the lock. Sarah is impressed. Jesse sees Sarah’s book under the sink, torn apart, and p up a photo.
Are you here for a casting? Sarah scoffs.
I’m sure you were great.
I know you saw me.
Oh.
Yeah. Oh.
It’s a great photo. You look really pretty.
Waste of time. Everyone wants you to look like a fucking preteen. This is pointed. Jesse does look like a preteen. She knee beside Sarah and holds out the book.
I bet you can fix this. Sarah makes no move to take it.
They're expensive.
Do you know how lucky you are?
What do you mean?  24.
Don’t do that. Sarah pulls the box of cigarettes from her purse, lights and sucks hard.

Sometimes I think God has favorites, you know? Some people are just born with more. People look at you. They notice. I walk down the street and no one sees me. I’m a ghost. She exhales and a puff of smoke winds up into the air.
What is that like?
What?
To be you? To walk into a room and all of a sudden it’s like - in the middle of winter, you’re the fucking sun. Jesse swallows.
(quietly) It’s everything. Sarah pulls Jesse toward her and puts the cigarette to he lips. Jesse takes a deep inhale, coughs.
Careful. Sarah brushes a piece of hair from Jesse’s face and tucks behind her ear. She brushes her lips down Jesse’s neck. Jesse closes her eyes, full of desire, until...

Shit! She loses her balance and stabs her hand on a piece of mirror. She rushes to the sink and runs the water. A larg triangular shard is stuck in her palm. She pulls it out, wincing, and it clinks in the drain. Blood follows.
Let me see.  25.
Fuck.
Let me see.
It’s really bad.
Here, let me see it. Jesse holds out her hand. The fatty muscle is visible.
Do you think I need stitches? I don’t have insurance. Sarah is staring at the cut.
(desperately) What do I do? Sarah impulsively puts Jesse’s hand to her mouth and begi to suck the blood from the wound. Jesse tries to pull awa
What the fuck?! Sarah sucks hungrily. Jesse manages to yank her hand away Sarah’s mouth is covered in blood.
What is wrong with you?!
Nothing!
What the fuck is wrong with you?
Nothing, nothing... Sarah's face streams with tears. Jesse runs from the bathroom. SARAH (CONT’D) Please don’t go! Jesse!  38 39 40 4l 42 26.

Jesse scrambles to the elevator and slams her hand onto t button, leaving a streak of blood. She looks toward the bathroom. INT. WOMEN’S RESTROOM - DAY 39 Sarah looks in the cracked mirror. Her eyes are black. He mouth is covered in blood. She looks like a monster. The anger begins to rise inside of her, and she sweeps he arms across the sink, sending shards of mirror whirling across the room.

Jesse! INT. HALLWAY/ELEVATOR -— DAY 40 We ZOOM quickly down the hall toward Jesse as she hears h name called out. She presses the button over and over. Finally, the ELEVATOR DINGS. She rushes on and hits the button for the ground floor. The doors close on Sarah who just misses the ride. Jesse backs as far away as she can. EXT. TAXI - DUSK 4l A cloud of gray smoke coughs out of the taxi’s tailpipe. INT./EXT. TAXI/JERRY’S MOTEL - DUSK 42 Jesse pulls a few crumpled bills from her wallet and hand them to the TAXI DRIVER. He notices blood on the money. She looks for something out the window.
Miss? HANK stands outside, an unlit cigarette in his mouth. He struggles to make the plastic Bic lighter catch, gives up throws it across the parking lot, and enters the office.
Are you alright?  43 44 45 46 27. She slides out of the taxi. EXT. JERRY’S MOTEL - DUSK 43 Jesse sprints up the outdoor stairs.
She struggles one-handed with the key and lock. The doorj has been rigged with duct tape, making it stick.

Come on. She looks over her shoulder and sees Hank step back out w a working lighter. She slams her weight against the door. It budges slightly. She tries again and the door swings open. Hank looks her way just as she slips inside.
Jesse slams the door and does the chain. She peeks behind the curtains to see if she was spotted.

Jesse's reflection in the medicine cabinet is deathly pal She opens the cabinet and examines the meager contents: toothpaste, deodorant, a bottle of peroxide. She grabs th peroxide and shuts the cabinet. She opens the bottle and pours a healthy amount over the wound on her hand, now caked in dried blood. The wound bubbles up, and the pain is almost unbearable. Jesse make sharp sound and sinks to the ground, clutching her hand t her chest. A KNOCK at the door.
Jesse? Still reeling in pain, she braces herself on the door fra with her good hand and stands, shaky on her feet.  28.

There is a deep purple bloodstain on the carpet from the wildcat. Jesse stumbles a little, dizzy. She peeks out the window. It is DEAN, shifting nervously. She opens the door and he presents a bouquet of red flowe She takes them.
Pretty. Dean peers into the motel room.
What happened in here? She starts to lose her balance.
Jesse! He tries to catch her, but she falls to the floor, fainti The flowers hit the ground and petals scatter everywhere.
Jesse’s eyes blink open. Dean is crouching over her. He holds up a hand with five fingers spread wide apart.
How many fingers do you see?
Four.
Try again.
Six.
Six?! How many fingers do you have? He grabs her bad hand to check for six fingers. She wince
What happened to you?  29.
Nothing.
Let me see. Jesse reluctantly unclenches her fist and shows Dean the wound. He stands.
Where are you going?
I’m taking you to the hospital.
No.
You need stitches.
It’s not that bad.
Not that bad? You fainted.
I know, I know. I just - I didn’t eat today and -
You didn’t eat?
I’m feeling much better. Honestly.
Why didn’t you eat?
I - forgot. Dean eyes her suspiciously.
Please don’t look at me like that. They sit in silence for a moment. Dean looks around the room.
This place is a mess.  30.
This fucking cat got in and wrecked everything.
Real party animal?
It ate my face cream. Small laughs.
You can’t stay here.
I don’t know where else to go.
I’ve got a couch. She shoots him a look. He grins.
Worth a shot.
Besides, I can’t leave.
Why not?
I owe them money.
For what?
For the damages.
It wasn’t your fault.
I left the window open.
So?
So you try telling him. The guy’s a creep. He won’t listen.  49 31. Dean looks at her, propped up against the bed, clutching hand. She is incredibly small. He stands.
Where are you going?
Stay here.
A LITTLE BELL JINGLES as Dean enters the office door. HANK has his feet up, flipping through an out-of-date Hus Magazine and shovelling sticky, red Chinese food into his mouth with a fork.
Are you the Manager?
Depends on who’s asking.
My friend says she owes you money. This gets Hank’s attention.
That so?
Room twenty-one.
Oh... The wildcat! Hank growls. His mouth is covered in red sauce.
That’s some hard candy, you know what I mean?
I’m sure I don’t. Hank looks him up and down.
What are you, a Mormon?  32.
No.
You with the DPH? Cuz we passed our last inspection. I’11 show you the paperwork.
I’m a photographer.
A photag, huh? Take any of these? He holds up the nude magazine.
Not my style.
Hmm. Hank turns back to the magazine, instantly sucked into on the pictures. For a minute he forgets about Dean. Dean clears his throat.
Right. Back to business. Your little friend’s a piece of work. Gonna have to replace the door and do a new spackle on the wall. Looking at... at least two-hundred.
Fine. Dean takes out his wallet and produces a wad of money. Ha eyes it hungrily.
Or was it three? They exchange a look.
I have two-forty in cash.
Sold! Hank rips the bills from his hand. He goes to a filing cabinet and unlocks the top drawer. He takes out a cash b counts the money, and puts it inside.  50 33.
There a pharmacy around here?
Why? She send you out for tampons, too?
You've got a real attitude problem.
That’s what I hear.
I could report you.
